meanings.definition: The state of being uncertain or not definite.
meanings.sent1: The uncertainnesses of the weather made planning the picnic difficult.
meanings.sent2: Her uncertainnesses about the exam outcome kept her up at night.
meanings.sent3: The uncertainnesses of the magic trick added an element of surprise to the show.
meanings.sent4: The uncertainnesses in his voice hinted at hidden emotions.
meanings.sent5: The uncertainnesses in the detective's findings kept the audience on the edge of their seats.

meanings.sent1: His uncertainnesses in his abilities held him back from pursuing his dreams.
meanings.sent2: The speaker's uncertainnesses were evident in the shaky delivery of the speech.
meanings.sent3: The uncertainnesses in her decision-making process led to some comical mishaps.
meanings.sent4: The uncertainnesses in her smile betrayed her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The uncertainnesses in his handshake revealed his nervousness.

meanings.sent1: The uncertainnesses surrounding the project deadline caused stress among the team.
meanings.sent2: There was a sense of uncertainnesses in the air as the negotiations continued.
meanings.sent3: The uncertainnesses in the recipe made for an interesting culinary experiment.
meanings.sent4: The uncertainnesses in her words left room for interpretation.
meanings.sent5: The uncertainnesses in the painting left viewers pondering its meaning.
